relation: Great for these types of students
If you love a warm, welcoming, fun environment Winthrop is for you. The student body is incredibly diverse and is openly accepting of people from all walks of life.
Don't come to Winthrop if you aren't willing to work. The classes are very rigorous to assure you're getting the best possible education and the professors do not take their subjects lightly.

Every college is expensive, but not every college is worth the tuition you have to pay... And at Winthrop, that is NOT the case. At Winthrop you get what you pay for and you're paying for quality education. Once you graduate you will have learned every skill you could possibly ever need for the field you plan on going into. Winthrop is worth EVERY penny you pay to attend.

I tell everyone that the second I stepped onto the grounds of Winthrop University it just felt right. I've been to Winthrop several times, both before and after I applied and was accepted and NEVER had a bad experience. Every one you come in contact with is open, friendly, and more than willing to lend a helping hand from the professors, to the students, and to the counselors. The campus has an out-of-this-world student center with a movie theatre, video games, TVs, ping pong tables, etc. so you can never be bored or without something to do. If you DON'T enjoy being at Winthrop, you just don't enjoy life.

All of the professors seem so knowledgeable of their subject area, and so ready and willing to give you the help you need and the best education possible. You're in classes that pertain to your major from day one. Of course there are the gen-ed classes sprinkled in, but you waste NO time getting the classes you need for the degree you want. No matter what your intended major is, you WILL get the education you want and deserve from Winthrop University.
pageTitle: Winthrop University Reviews: Student Reviews and Ratings | Cappex

textAfterTable: Categories Comments Great for these types of students Prospective teachers, art majors, biology majors Tips for prospective students Get to know your advisor. Bang for the buck A teacher I had my first semester here said, Winthrop is like the beauty parlor of SC universities. You get private school attention for a public school price. It's a small school and the teacher to student ratio is very comforting. Am enjoying being here I have never had better relationships with teachers as I have had in my first two semesters here. Am learning a lot I never thought I'd learn so much pursuing a Computer Science degree from a liberal arts college. The classes are small so you receive individual attention from teachers who really care, and are more than willing to meet with you after class to help you with anything. Login to rate or flag the reviews Nontombe from Columbia, SC 08/17/2009 Reviewer is A current student here.
